channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Russia Demands Role in Guaranteeing Ukraine’s Postwar Security
item.description: European and Ukrainian officials call the idea ludicrous, showing the large gaps in peace negotiations.

item.title: Trump’s Tactics Mean Many International Students Won’t Make It to Campus
item.description: Students from some countries won’t make it to class this fall because of President Trump’s travel ban. Others can’t get visa appointments. Some are si...

item.title: OpenAI’s chairman says ChatGPT is ‘obviating’ his own job—and says AI is like an ‘Iron Man suit’ for workers
item.description: Bret Taylor says computer programmers like himself may face an existential crisis.

item.title: Senate Adds Guardrails in an Effort to Force Trump to Obey Spending Bills
item.description: Leaders of the Appropriations Committee are trying to tighten up funding legislation to give the Trump administration less leeway to refuse to spend f...

item.title: Why the NFL drafted Microsoft’s gen AI for the league’s next big play
item.description: The NFL and Microsoft announced a new multiyear partnership extension that includes the deployment of 2,500 Microsoft Surface Copilot+ PCs.

item.title: ‘This isn’t about free speech. I’m sure they’re gonna holler that’: Minnesota sues TikTok, accusing it of preying on the young
item.description: The lawsuit, filed in state court, alleges that TikTok is violating Minnesota laws against deceptive trade practices and consumer fraud.

item.title: Sony will pass on tariff costs to U.S. consumers by hiking Playstation 5 prices
item.description: The PlayStation 5 is currently the most popular gaming console in America.

item.title: Washington DC leads America in unemployment rate for 3rd straight month
item.description: D.C.'s jobless rate reached 6% in July, a reflection of the mass layoffs of federal workers, and collapsing international tourism.

item.title: Judge Halts Texas Law Mandating the Ten Commandments in School
item.description: The state law had said public schools would have to display the Ten Commandments in a “conspicuous” location in every classroom in Texas by Sept. 1.

item.title: More Adams Associates and Supporters Are Said to Face Corruption Charges
item.description: Among those expected to surrender in the coming days are Mayor Eric Adams’s closest adviser and a friend whom the mayor installed in a powerful city p...

item.title: Drone Explosion in Haiti Kills 2 SWAT Members, Injures 6 Others
item.description: A drone intended for attacking gang members detonated at a police base, raising questions about how the deadly operations are conducted.

item.title: Russia Demands Role in Guaranteeing Ukraine’s Postwar Security
item.description: European and Ukrainian officials call the idea ludicrous, showing the large gaps in peace negotiations.

item.title: What Russia Is Doing to Grab Ukrainian Land While It Still Can
item.description: As negotiations over the war carry on, President Vladimir V. Putin is pushing hard with tactics that have evolved over three and a half years.

item.title: Hong Kong Government Fixates on ‘Soft Resistance’
item.description: With pro-democracy movements long squashed, the government is targeting any hint of subtler expressions of discontent. Even establishment figures say ...

item.title: Xi Jinping Visits Tibet as Dalai Lama’s Succession Looms
item.description: A power struggle is taking shape over choosing a successor to the 90-year-old Buddhist leader. In a trip to Tibet’s capital, China’s leader emphasized...
